paper_abstract: Despite recent progress, computational tools that identify gene fusions from next-generation whole transcriptome sequencing data are often limited in accuracy and scalability. Here, we present a software package, BreakFusion that combines the strength of reference alignment followed by read-pair analysis and de novo assembly to achieve a good balance in sensitivity, specificity and computational efficiency.
paper_title: BreakFusion: targeted assembly-based identification of gene fusions in whole transcriptome paired-end sequencing data
